name: Subway Busker
description: A talented musician is playing guitar in the subway station. Their soulful melody fills the underground space. A small crowd has gathered, and a tip jar sits at their feet.

0.name: Give a generous tip (-$200) | 20%
0.description: You drop $200 in the tip jar. The musician looks up and gives you a warm smile. 'Thank you so much, friend!' The music seems to get even better as you walk away feeling good about yourself.

1.name: Toss in some change (-$50) | 50%
1.description: You toss a few dollars into the jar. The musician nods appreciatively and continues their set. You enjoyed the music and feel good about supporting street artists.

2.name: Keep walking ($0) | 30%
2.description: You're in a hurry and walk past without stopping. The music fades as you head toward your destination. Maybe next time.

name: Fallen Groceries
description: An elderly person's grocery bag just ripped open, sending oranges and cans rolling across the sidewalk. They look overwhelmed trying to pick everything up.

0.name: Help them out ($300) | 60%
0.description: You help gather all the groceries and even offer to carry them to their car. The grateful stranger insists you take $300 for your kindness. 'Young people like you restore my faith in humanity!'

1.name: Pick up a few items nearby ($0) | 30%
1.description: You grab a couple of rolling oranges and hand them back with a smile. They thank you warmly as you continue on your way.

2.name: You're running late, keep moving (-$50) | 10%
2.description: You hurry past, avoiding eye contact. While running, you don't notice $50 falling out of your pocket. Guess this is karma...

name: Street Magician's Challenge
description: A street magician stops you with a confident grin. 'Pick a card, any card! If I guess wrong, I'll give you $500. If I guess right, you owe me $200. What do you say?'

0.name: Accept the challenge (-$200) | 40%
0.description: 'Is THIS your card?' The magician reveals your exact card with a theatrical flourish. The gathering crowd applauds. You grudgingly hand over $200 - fair is fair. At least you were entertained!

1.name: Watch but don't participate ($0) | 60%
1.description: You turn him down but stick around to watch. The next person loses the bet - this guy is good! Glad you didn't risk your money.

name: Lost Wallet
description: You spot a leather wallet on the ground. Inside there's $2000 cash and an ID card with an address nearby. What do you do?

0.name: Return it to the owner ($500) | 50%
0.description: You track down the owner using the ID. They're incredibly relieved - it was their rent money! They insist you take $500 as a reward. 'You're a lifesaver!'

1.name: Turn it in to the police ($0) | 30%
1.description: You drop it off at the nearest police station. The officer thanks you and takes your information in case the owner wants to thank you. You did the right thing.

2.name: Take the cash and leave the wallet ($2000) | 20%
2.description: You pocket the $2000 and leave the wallet where someone else will find it. You feel guilty, but times are tough...

name: Food Truck Surprise
description: A new food truck has a sign: 'Mystery Meal - $150! Could be our $400 wagyu special or a simple sandwich. Feeling lucky?'

0.name: Try the mystery meal (-$150) | 80%
0.description: You hand over $150 and receive... a basic ham sandwich. The chef shrugs apologetically. 'Can't win em all!' At least it tastes okay.

1.name: Order from the regular menu (-$60) | 10%
1.description: You play it safe and order a regular chicken wrap for $60. It's delicious and filling - no regrets!

2.name: You already ate, pass ($0) | 10%
2.description: The smell is tempting but you're not hungry. You walk past and save your money for later.

name: Parking Ticket
description: You notice a parking officer writing a ticket for your car! You're only 2 minutes over the meter. They haven't put the ticket on the windshield yet...

0.name: Run over and plead your case ($0) | 60%
0.description: You sprint over apologizing profusely. The officer sighs but tears up the ticket. 'Just this once. Feed your meter next time!' Close call - you saved $750!

1.name: Accept the ticket gracefully (-$750) | 20%
1.description: Fair is fair - you were over the time limit. You take the $750 ticket and make a mental note to set a phone alarm next time.

2.name: Pretend it's not your car (-$1000) | 20%
2.description: You walk past casually, but the officer recognizes you from your registration photo. 'Nice try.' The ticket is now $1000 for attempted evasion.

name: Coworker's Birthday Collection
description: Someone's passing around a card and collection envelope for a coworker's birthday gift. You barely know them, but everyone seems to be contributing.

0.name: Contribute $200 (-$200) | 40%
0.description: You add $200 to the envelope. Your manager notices and mentions it at the party. 'Such a generous team we have!' Good for office politics.

1.name: Add $50 and sign the card (-$50) | 50%
1.description: You contribute a modest amount and write a nice message. Nobody judges - it's the thought that counts.

2.name: Just sign the card ($0) | 10%
2.description: You write 'Happy Birthday!' and pass it along without contributing. A bit awkward but your budget is tight this month.

name: Vending Machine Malfunction
description: The office vending machine just dispensed your $2 snack AND returned your money! It also seems to be stuck in a loop, ready to give more free items...

0.name: Report it to maintenance ($100) | 30%
0.description: You do the right thing and report the malfunction. The maintenance guy is grateful and gives you $100 from the petty cash as thanks for your honesty.

1.name: Take as many snacks as you can ($800) | 50%
1.description: You grab $800 worth of items before walking away. Free snacks! You feel a little guilty but hey, victimless crime right?

2.name: Just take your snack and leave ($20) | 20%
2.description: You got what you paid for (plus your money back). You walk away with your $20 snack and your conscience intact.

name: Suspicious Email
description: You receive an email claiming you've won $10,000 in a lottery you don't remember entering. To claim it, you need to pay a $500 'processing fee.'

0.name: Pay the fee - could be real! (-$500) | 20%
0.description: You send the $500 and... nothing. The email address stops responding. Classic scam. You feel foolish and $50 poorer.

1.name: Delete it immediately ($0) | 20%
1.description: You recognize the scam and delete the email. Good instincts - your bank account remains safe.

2.name: Report it as phishing ($250) | 60%
2.description: You report the email to your IT department. They're impressed by your vigilance and award you a $250 gift card from the security awareness program!

name: Flat Tire Situation
description: You notice someone on the roadside struggling with a flat tire. They look frustrated and keep checking their phone - probably waiting for roadside assistance.

0.name: Stop and help change it ($400) | 30%
0.description: You walk over and help change the tire. Turns out it's a local business owner who insists on giving you their card and $400 cash. 'Come by my shop anytime - first service is free!'

1.name: Offer to call someone for them ($0) | 70%
1.description: You stop briefly to check if they need help calling someone. They already have help coming but appreciate you stopping. Good karma!

name: Coffee Shop Mix-Up
description: The barista accidentally gives you a fancy $80 latte instead of your $30 regular coffee. They haven't noticed the mistake yet.

0.name: Point out the mistake ($30) | 30%
0.description: You let them know about the mix-up. The grateful barista says 'Keep it anyway! And here's a free $30 pastry for being honest.' Score!

1.name: Quietly enjoy the upgrade ($50) | 50%
1.description: You take the fancy latte and find a seat. It IS delicious... but you feel a little guilty enjoying someone else's order.

2.name: Ask them to remake your original order ($0) | 20%
2.description: You really wanted your regular coffee, not some fancy drink. They remake it and you get exactly what you wanted.

name: Neighbor's Package
description: A delivery driver accidentally left your neighbor's package at your door. It looks like something expensive based on the shipping label from an electronics store.

0.name: Bring it to your neighbor ($200) | 60%
0.description: You walk it over to their house. Your neighbor is thrilled - it's a birthday gift they were worried about! They give you $200 and promise to watch your place next time you're away.

1.name: Keep it - finder's keepers ($0) | 40%
1.description: You open it to find... a baby monitor. Not even useful to you. Now you feel bad AND have a useless item. Should have just returned it.

name: Office Lottery Pool
description: Your coworkers are pooling money for lottery tickets. The jackpot is $500 million! They want $100 from each person to join the pool.

0.name: Join the pool ($100) | 30%
0.description: You chip in $100. The drawing happens and... nothing. Not even a single number matched. Oh well, it was fun to dream for a day!

1.name: Politely decline ($0) | 40%
1.description: You pass on this one. The next day your coworkers are all still at work - clearly they didn't win either. Smart financial choice!

2.name: Buy your own ticket instead ($980) | 30%
2.description: You buy your own $20 ticket. You don't win the jackpot but you do match four numbers for a $1000 prize! Better than the pool did.

name: Gym Membership Offer
description: A gym promoter stops you on the street. 'Special offer TODAY ONLY! Annual membership for just $2000 - normally $6000!' They're very persistent.

0.name: Sign up for the deal (-$2000) | 90%
0.description: You sign up, excited about your fitness journey! ...Three months later, you've been twice. Classic gym membership regret.

1.name: Firmly say no thanks ($0) | 10%
1.description: 'I already have a gym membership,' you lie confidently. They move on to the next target. Crisis averted!

name: Found Money
description: You find 3 crumpled a $200 bills on the ground near an ATM. There's no one around who might have dropped it.

0.name: Pocket them - lucky day! ($600) | 60%
0.description: You pocket the $600 with a smile. Free money! Sometimes the universe just gives you a little gift.

1.name: Turn them in to the bank ($0) | 40%
1.description: You give them to the bank teller in case someone comes looking. They seem surprised anyone would bother. Honesty doesn't always pay.
